rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 7: Line 7:
In 1979, he designed the [[Bar Cel Ona]] logo, a work that would make him popular. The following year, he opened the first bar in Valencia designed by Mariscal, together with [[Fernando Salas]], the Duplex, for which he designed one of his most famous pieces, the Duplex stool, an authentic icon of the 1980s. In 1981, his work as a furniture designer led him to participate in the exhibition Memphis, an International Style, in Milan. In 1987, he gave an exhibition at the [[Centre Georges Pompidou]] in Paris and participated in the [[Documenta de Kassel]].
In 1979, he designed the [[Bar Cel Ona]] logo, a work that would make him popular. The following year, he opened the first bar in Valencia designed by Mariscal, together with [[Fernando Salas]], the Duplex, for which he designed one of his most famous pieces, the Duplex stool, an authentic icon of the 1980s. In 1981, his work as a furniture designer led him to participate in the exhibition Memphis, an International Style, in Milan. In 1987, he gave an exhibition at the [[Centre Georges Pompidou]] in Paris and participated in the [[Documenta de Kassel]].

[[Image:1972cobi460.jpg|200px|thumb|right|Cobi, the mascot of [[1992 Summer Olympics]].]]
 
Throughout the 1980s, he designed several textile collections for Marieta and TrÃ¡fico de Modas and exhibited at the [[VinÃ§on]] salon in Barcelona. In 1989, [[Cobi]] was chosen as the mascot for the [[Barcelona 1992]] [[Olympic Games]]. The mascot was the centre of great controversy because of its vanguard image, although time has shown its creator to have been right and now [[Cobi]] is recognised as the most profitable mascot in the history of the modern games. He later created the cartoon series The Cobi Troupe.
Throughout the 1980s, he designed several textile collections for Marieta and TrÃ¡fico de Modas and exhibited at the [[VinÃ§on]] salon in Barcelona. In 1989, [[Cobi]] was chosen as the mascot for the [[Barcelona 1992]] [[Olympic Games]]. The mascot was the centre of great controversy because of its vanguard image, although time has shown its creator to have been right and now [[Cobi]] is recognised as the most profitable mascot in the history of the modern games. He later created the cartoon series The Cobi Troupe.
